posts.author: TheSquid

This is my go at a Strength-based Paladin. I went for some kind of balance instead of ultra-high AB (see e.g. the Divine Devastator), and I rather liked the result. I borrowed Orion’s concept of “pseudo-devastating critical”, meaning your critical hits will show very pleasant three-digit numbers of different colours. Tried and tested on the World of Greyhawk PW server.

Features:
  • Full undispellable Paladin power with 44 unbuffed AB
  • Divine Shield and Divine Might (11 rounds)
  • Craft Wand and Extend Spell to cover for the lack of slots
  • Expertise + Taunt 58(64)
  • Usual RDD goodies
  • Can use arcane scrolls
  • Maximally efficient starting stat allocation
Cons:
  • Starved on feats, with 3 pre-epic feats in epic levels
  • I guess AB could be higher

Commentary:
This was my first attempt at designing and playing a Paladin, and it felt very solid. She is a strong warrior capable of obliterating her foes by virtue of smacking them in the head with a mercurial greatsword. She is immune to fear, fire and paralysis and has decent saves. She can reliably taunt the whitest of dragons on WoG.

Assuming +12 to the relevant stats and +5AC items, she has:
Buffed AB = 63 (69 with Taunt) +11 on a Smite, +7 with True Strike.
Buffed AC = 54
Add to that Haste, +5 boots, and +4 Bracers of Shielding and we get to 67, still buffable by Expertise.
Damage = 52–66 plus any bonus damage on her sword.
Critical chance with keen sword: 18–20 x4.
With a bit of lucky item drops and/or a Flame Weapon scroll she can hope to deal 300 damage on a single hit, not to mention Smite Evil.

I knew I wanted Craft Wand and Extend Spell for this build, to actually make use of the Paladin spellbook. This unfortunately meant that I had to take 3 pre-epic feats in epic levels. I could have gone for two more Great Strengths for +1AB and +1 damage, but I figured boosting Taunt would be more effective, and a high Discipline is always nice to have. I lost 6 AB in the end, compared to what could be done with this build if min-maxed. Posterity will judge, I had fun and regret nothing. 

There are *plenty* of similar builds in the old archive, but all of them are smiters or go for the DevCrit route (which I find takes up way too many feats in this build). 
Well, except for this one, which looks hilariously good.
In this forum there are several more modern and refined builds in this thread.
The one I like the most is Empyre65’s Paladin of Bahamut (similar to mine but with no Expertise and no Taunt in exchange for better overall stats) but they all look very good.

Overall, this class combination allows for several (minor) adjustments to one's preferred playstyle, and they all look strong. Paladins, it pains me to say it, are actually fun to play too.
